charities.name: Adopt A Family Marin
charities.about: Over the last 30 years, Adopt A Family has helped to prevent the road to homelessness which families face. Their goal is no homeless children living in Marin. They help families stay stable in their fight against poverty.
charities.address: 35 Mitchell Bvld. Suite 16, San Rafael, CA

charities.name: Bloom Marin
charities.about: Bloom provides the seeds for successful transitions, clothing, life skills, hope for men, women and children.

charities.name: Hospice of Marin Hodgepoge
charities.about: Moving? Cleaning out closets? Donating gently-used household items, furniture, books, gifts, clothing and collectibles to our thrift stores is an easy way to support Hospice by the Bay.

charities.name: Ritter Center
charities.about: The Ritter Center's mission is to prevent homelessness and improve the health and well-being of individuals and families who are homeless or low-income by providing a range of culturally sensitive, easily accessible, high quality medical care and social services.

charities.name: Global Book Exchange of Marin
charities.about: The Global Book Exchange of Marin works with youth, educators and service clubs to deliver new homes for K-12 textbooks, library books, and educational meterials. They also offer books to families, teachers, schools, and non-profits to encourage literacy for everyone.
charities.address: 852 Del Ganado Road, San Rafael, CA

charities.name: Marin Humane Society
charities.about: The Marin Humane Society transforms lives through exceptional care, humane education, and advocacy. Every day, they inspre compassion and positive relationships between animals and people. They wish to see a world where every animal is treated in a humane fashion.
charities.address: 171 Bel Marin Keys Bvld, Novato, CA

charities.name: San Francisco Music Center
charities.about: The San Francisco Music center makes music accessible to all people, regardless of their financial status. They believe that there is a power in music to connect people and cultures. They are a hub for sharing this music with everyone.

charities.name: St. Vincent de Paul Society
charities.about: The St. Vincent de Paul Society strives to give care and important services to people who are struggling in Marin County. Their main programs include, the free dining room, the homeless outreach team, and the jobs stipend and employment training program. They believe that everyone deserves food, housing, and a chance for a better life.

charities.name: ELM
charities.about: ELM provides youth with an immersive music education and resources that inspire and empower them to pursue their dreams. ELM has seen the inequality that talent is equally distributed, but opportunities are not. ELM is one way this access divide can be addressed in music.
charities.address: 2955 Kerner Blvd. Suite B, San Rafael, CA

charities.name: Halleck Creek Ranch
charities.about: Halleck Creek Ranch invites people with disabilities, and their families, to live a "Life without barriers" through the beneficial activity of therapeutic horseback riding. Horseback riding promotes a unique sense of freedom and mobility, allowing riders to imagine the future, and to enjoy the present, in a way they never thought possible.
items: Horseback Riding Helmets (Small and Medium, no more than 2 years old, Troxel or International)

charities.name: Hooves for Harmony
charities.about: Hooves for Harmony offers horse therapy to children with special needs at Morning Star Farm in Novato. They focus on nurturing personal development in youth through volunteer service and horsemanship.
items: Horseback Riding Helmets (Small and Medium, New or Gently Used)

charities.name: Okizu
charities.about: Okizu's goal is to help all members of families affected by childhood cancer to heal through peer support, respite, mentoring, and recreational programs. All of their programs are offered for free to families dealing with pediatric cancer. Any child and family who is suffering from cancer may attend regardless of their location, condition, and economic background.

charities.name: Forwords Literacy Lab
charities.about: Forwards is an educational organization which seeks to bring literacy to everyone. They help students overcome language, cultural, and economic barriers. Their work focuses on making sure that all of their student will become confident and productive members of society.
charities.address: 361 Third St., Suite I, San Rafael, CA. 94901

charities.name: Downtown Streets Team
charities.about: The Downtown Streets Team help homeless people in Marin and other areas. They treat the people who they help with dignity and they make them feel empowered. Those who they help work on projects with them. The Downtown Streets Team's ultimate goal is to transition the people who the help into empoyment and having a job. They believe that having a job restores hope and creates opportunity, so the Downtown Streets Team helps homeless people do this.

charities.name: Side by Side
charities.about: At Side by Side they walk with young people impacted by adversity on their unique journeys to heal from trauma, restore resilience, and embrace their own potential.They provide critical services to satisfy the young people's needs, and set them on a positive path away from dangerous conditions and behaviors.
charities.address: 300 Sunny Hills Drive, Bldg. #5 San Anselmo, CA 94960

charities.name: Community Action Marin
charities.about: Community Action Marin strives for everyone in Marin to achieve well being by getting educational, health, and other essential servies. They cover financial emergencies, they provide child care and early childhood education, they help people manage their mental health, and so much more. They are willing to help anyone along their road to properity.
items: Sleeping Bags (30 degrees fahrenheit or less)

charities.name: Trips for Kids Marin
charities.about: Trips for Kids Marin provides biking experiences for kids who are underprivilaged. They inspire a healthy lifestyle through teaching the kids biking. The kids are also helped to understand their positive value and the wonders of being outdoors and in nature.

charities.name: Marin Foster Care Association
charities.about: The Marin Foster Care Association brings safe, quality care to all foster children in Marin County. They do so by providing support services and advocacy to all foster and adoptive families. The in-kind donations which they accept are mostly related to getting the kids something special for their accomplishments.

charities.name: SCRAP SF
charities.about: SCRAP is a creative resue center in San Francisco. They put new life into craft supplies, and they annually divert 200 tons of materials from the landfill. SCRAP is a place for the community to find materials for educational programs, createive projects, and their classrooms. They deliver underprivilaged students art kits and instruction, and so much more.
items: National Geographic Magazines (Must be National Geographic)

charities.name: Marin Maker Space
charities.about: The Marin Maker Space is a part of the Marinovation Learning Center. They are an enviornment for youth to create and play collaboratively. They help youth find and create solutions which enable thier future.

charities.name: Make It Home Bay Area
charities.about: Moke It Home helps people transitioning out of homelessness find essential household items. They bring in gently used items to help make their transition as smooth as possible. All of their work goes into their goal of ending furniture poverty in the Bay Area.
charities.address: In order to donate, please use this form here to arrange a pickup. [Alternate]
